intro: Calceolaria prichardii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada slipper orchid, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its distinctive slipper-shaped flowers, which are typically violet or purple in color. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is commonly found in mountainous regions. Calceolaria prichardii is a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution and specific habitat requirements.
